website_summaries.verdict: A road bike inner tube made for general road rides and touring. Economy pack makes a great emergency supply.
pros: Lightweight construction with the ability to hold a high volume of air for less rolling resistance
Comes with the more common Presta valve that is compatible with most road bike pumps
cons: Cannot remove valve stem cores to add sealant for extra tire puncture resistance

customer_reviews.title: Solid tubes, smooth stem and no removable core
customer_reviews.text: Great tubes! Take note, they have a smooth (not threaded) valve stem, though the end is threaded for a cap or inflator. They also do NOT have a removable valve core, which is good for me because my thread-on inflator was freezing to the cores of other tubes and unscrewing them, letting all the air out.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Tice

customer_reviews.title: Previously bad purchases the Continental brand and had multiple faults
customer_reviews.text: Previously bad purchases the Continental brand and had multiple faults. Just installed the first one of the Kenda tubes and the material is a thick rubber and installed no problem. Previous Kenda tubes I've ridden on have gone 100s of miles with no issues. These appear to be very sturdy, much more so than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Cody R. Lusnia

customer_reviews.title: They work fine for me
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about these tubes, medium weight butyl. Mine came with threaded valves and removable cores. A plus for some but for most it doesn't make a difference. 48mm is to the end of the core when it's installed, the same way most valves are measured. A little long for your typical aluminum rim but the only downside is aesthetics. With a valve stem on the shorter side it can be tough to get the pump head to grip at times so I am more than happy with a touch long.. I've only installed one but it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Shepardson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: good thing I bought 4 tubes
customer_reviews.text: the product is as stated and fine, except that these tubes walls are pretty thin, so you have to be really careful when installing the last few inches that have to be pushed over the rim. I have bike tools to help, worked at a shop in college and have replaced, installed repaired & probably dozens inner tubes over the years, so I know what I am doing but these were by far the hardest and tightest to get on. I ruined one tube even using plastic (I have metal as well) tire tools for bikes though I was super careful. once installed they seem to be fine, though I only have about 120 miles on them so far.
customer_reviews.author: FC4S fan

customer_reviews.title: Inner core is not removable!!!!!  Yay!
customer_reviews.text: These inner tubes do not have the removable insert at the valve, which is awesome! I have a tiny hand pump for my bike, and I don't really have garage space for a big pump. I have had so many frustrating times with other inner tubes where I finally get the pressure up to 100 psi and then it completely deflates the instant I unscrew my pump. These inner tubes have been perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: ATC

customer_reviews.title: These are good solid tubes
customer_reviews.text: These are good solid tubes, but they are thick which is both good and bad. Bad if you have limited space to carry an extra tube on the bike, but good in that they appear to be a bit more heavy duty and durable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Valve Stems Are Weak
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 4-pack, this is my second set. The most recent set seems to be of lower quality, but they are cheap, right? You have to be careful when handling these. Don't over tighten the lock nut that go over the stem, it'll cause it to leak from the tube itself. Also be careful when threading and unthreading the fill valve. They are pretty flimsy, but fine as long as you don't crank them too much. Pros: long valve stem makes it easy to fill. The price is right. Lastly, I wouldn't pump past 80 psi. I did and one began to leak at the valve stem. I'll try for 90 next week, but they're fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: total garbageeeeee
customer_reviews.text: total garbage. had the first tube fail instantly i went to put a small bit of air for some form and right away could hear it flowing out of the tube, fresh out of the packing had a leak. i patched it and decided to try using it anyways the second it got to 80 psi it exploded which made me so mad i even wasted a patch. second tube wouldnt hold air either. im so frustrated that i waited a few days for these to not even work ill be stopping at auper walmart and returning these via amazon. dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps I got a bad batch. Will not be ordering these again
customer_reviews.text: Tubes appear to be defective. First tube popped while inflating and a second went flat after a mile of riding. Both tubes popped in the same exact place (area around the valve). Perhaps I got a bad batch. Will not be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dziomba

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 4 was bad
customer_reviews.text: Came in on time, had to install a second one as the first one turned out to have a hole, should have checked it before installing, but the other 3 came out good, now only time will tell if they are good enough. Only 3 stars as 3/4 came out good
customer_reviews.author: NANCY Z.

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: took a chance instead of going to to the LBS - bulk packed and one tube didn’t even match the others - two tubes failed with first installation, side seam split open. one tube continues to lose air slowly and bleeds out after two days. I’ve used Kenda tubes in the past but this batch was garbage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bowlin

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash...DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Only used 2 so far and both have blown near stem after only a few miles. Guess you get what you pay for, or in this case you dont get anything for what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hinz

customer_reviews.title: Good tubes for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tube, it holds air. These seem as reliable as any other tube I have bought. I appreciate the non threaded stems.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett K. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I like these tubes. Combined with my tires, I have very few flats
customer_reviews.author: niceville318

customer_reviews.title: Look OK
customer_reviews.text: Bought these accidentally. They looked ok. I returned them without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Swymer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: working well so far and seem of good quality. so far not many miles of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Horning

customer_reviews.title: Good tube at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Put the tube in my trainers wheel and have a bit over 2oo hours so far. Typically the rollers eat up tires and tubes so we will see but it looks promising
customer_reviews.author: Gary0529

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal on tubes
customer_reviews.text: These were the same brand and size that my bike came with. Installed as expected. Stems are a little longer, but that doesn't effect the performance of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Trojniak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 6KU
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the 6KU bike on Amazon! These were easy to install and were honestly higher quality than the ones that came with my bike. Definitely get them!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Cole

customer_reviews.title: Thicker Heavy Duty Butyl, Maintains Air Pressure Longer
customer_reviews.text: Used these with on new wheel set with Continental Gatorskins for major flat-prevention.
customer_reviews.author: NKQ

customer_reviews.title: Thick and heavy
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried installing them, and I hope I don't need to.
customer_reviews.author: johntwstws

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality parts
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, all 4 popped while being filled or within a short distance of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sent wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 700x23-25 4pack and received 700x23-28. Won't fit my rims; to big !
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G. Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and no leaks
customer_reviews.text: Seem like good tubes. No leaks and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have worked great so far. Daily riding in Az heat and terrible roads for a month and a half with no flats and once a week topping off the air. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: No thread on stem
customer_reviews.text: No thread and retainer nut, may cause noise on bumpy road but it works for my need. OK quality
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Flat in a month
customer_reviews.text: All went flat within one month. Changed out tires and tubes, made sure they were installed correctly, still ended up flat.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Bad stems
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this pack twice now and each time I've received tubes with bad stems. I thought it was me, but 4 tubes later and the same result - it's not me
customer_reviews.author: Mike Anna McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: 2 of them were unusable. One of the good ones popped immediately as I started riding too. buy a set of Goodyears trust me
customer_reviews.author: Marco Carral

customer_reviews.title: Holey tubes, Batman!
customer_reviews.text: One came with a hole from the factory. Others developed holes after a couple of rides.
customer_reviews.author: Marko

customer_reviews.title: Very fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very good value and the one day delivery is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jose F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use Kenda's tubes for the last 5,000 miles on my two bikes without any flat.
customer_reviews.author: MiltonTheMonster

customer_reviews.title: Quality Service
customer_reviews.text: I received my order on time and it was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Scot A. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem to last
customer_reviews.text: Have had two burst in the past week while not using the bike. My bike sees mild use from a work commute.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good tunes, very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. I keep my tires at around 75 to 80 psi and none of these have burst yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ferdinando

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect for my presta to schinder adapter for my mini hand pump great tire
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and two were defective right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Silver

customer_reviews.title: Tires popped. Not very strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought four and three popped on the first day. Seemed a little cheap
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Nice tubes, wish the valves were threaded
customer_reviews.text: I would have preferred threaded values but this is a very nice tube and way, way, way better than the cheap ones you can find on Amazon. I tried a few different cheap tubes and they always get flats right away and so far with these I've not had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. DFW

customer_reviews.title: They hold air better then other brands
customer_reviews.text: My go to tire. I had one for over go 3000 miles without a puncture. They hold air better then other brands.
customer_reviews.author: douglas m forsyth

customer_reviews.title: They hold air but the valve stem is not removable ...
customer_reviews.text: They hold air but the valve stem is not removable it's also not threaded. But they hold air so whoohoo time to ride
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Only leaving 4 stars because you have to make sure you have a smaller connector for your tire pump! Other than that, I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Worst tubes I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I can't get the pump head to stay on the valve stem without the tube leaking air after a few pumps. I have to reseat the pump head multiple times to fill it up once. This is so frustrating! Eventually, the valve started leaking when it is closed. I didn't have this problem with the Continental tubes I had.
customer_reviews.author: Sigmapi

product_meta.title: Kenda 700x23-25c Bicycle Inner Tubes - 48mm Smooth Presta Valve - 4 Pack
product_meta.description: Kenda 700x23-25c Bicycle Inner Tubes - 48mm Smooth Presta Valve - 4 Pack
feature_bullets: high-quality, stable air pressure butyl tube

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
